body:
From the last frame of the tracebacks, that seem like a bug in powerline.

On Jul 4, 2017 12:19 PM, "Florian Gesser" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I wanted to start ipython3 this morning and was greeted with this nasty
> welcome:
>
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets.py", line 490, in get
>     value = obj._trait_values[self.name]
> KeyError: 'prompts'
>
> ipython3 --version
> 6.1.0
> python3 --version
> Python 3.6.1
>
> full traceback:
>
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets.py", line 490, in get
>     value = obj._trait_values[self.name]
> KeyError: 'prompts'
>
> During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
>
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/usr/local/bin/ipython3", line 11, in <module>
>     sys.exit(start_ipython())
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/__init__.py", line 125, in start_ipython
>     return launch_new_instance(argv=argv, **kwargs)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/config/application.py", line 830, in launch_instance
>     app.initialize(argv)
>   File "<decorator-gen-112>", line 2, in initialize
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/config/application.py", line 88, in catch_config_error
>     return method(app, *args, **kwargs)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/terminal/ipapp.py", line 317, in initialize
>     self.init_shell()
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/terminal/ipapp.py", line 333, in init_shell
>     ipython_dir=self.ipython_dir, user_ns=self.user_ns)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/config/configurable.py", line 508, in instance
>     inst = cls(*args, **kwargs)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/terminal/interactiveshell.py", line 426, in __init__
>     self.init_prompt_toolkit_cli()
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/terminal/interactiveshell.py", line 275, in init_prompt_toolkit_cli
>     **self._layout_options()
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/terminal/interactiveshell.py", line 353, in _layout_options
>     'get_prompt_tokens':self.prompts.in_prompt_tokens,
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets.py", line 525, in __get__
>     return self.get(obj, cls)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets.py", line 493, in get
>     default = obj.trait_defaults(self.name)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets.py", line 1477, in trait_defaults
>     return self._get_trait_default_generator(names[0])(self)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets/traitlets.py", line 928, in __call__
>     return self.func(*args, **kwargs)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/IPython/terminal/interactiveshell.py", line 168, in _prompts_default
>     return self.prompts_class(self)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/powerline/bindings/ipython/since_5.py", line 62, in __init__
>     powerline.do_setup(shell, self, shutdown_hook)
>   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/powerline/bindings/ipython/since_5.py", line 26, in do_setup
>     saved_msfn = ip._make_style_from_name
> AttributeError: 'TerminalInteractiveShell' object has no attribute '_make_style_from_name'
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/10690>, or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAUez1eVLDgJ5XQ8U7feR2acBPJ5vcXfks5sKhGfgaJpZM4ONKty>
> .
>

The last bit is the real exception, and it's coming from the 'powerline' package. It appears to be calling a private method from IPython which has changed. So this is not a bug from our point of view. If the powerline people need better public APIs, they're welcome to ask for them.
